verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <S%H5329><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> The king <S%H4428><s%> shall joy <S%H8055><s%> in thy strength, <S%H5797><s%> O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> and in thy salvation <S%H3444><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> greatly <S%H3966><s%> shall he rejoice! <S%H1523><s%>

Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> him his heart's <S%H3820><s%> desire, <S%H8378><s%> and hast not <S%H1077><s%> withheld <S%H4513><s%> the request <S%H782><s%> of his lips. <S%H8193><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> thou preventest <S%H6923><s%> him with the blessings <S%H1293><s%> of goodness: <S%H2896><s%> thou settest <S%H7896><s%> a crown <S%H5850><s%> of pure gold <S%H6337><s%> on his head. <S%H7218><s%>
He asked <S%H7592><s%> life <S%H2416><s%> of <S%H4480><s%> thee, and thou gavest <S%H5414><s%> it him, even length <S%H753><s%> of days <S%H3117><s%> forever <S%H5769><s%> and ever. <S%H5703><s%>
His glory <S%H3519><s%> is great <S%H1419><s%> in thy salvation: <S%H3444><s%> honor <S%H1935><s%> and majesty <S%H1926><s%> hast thou laid <S%H7737><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> him.

For <S%H3588><s%> thou hast made <S%H7896><s%> him most blessed <S%H1293><s%> forever: <S%H5703><s%> thou hast made him exceeding glad <S%H2302><s%> <S%H8057><s%> with <S%H854><s%> thy countenance. <S%H6440><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> trusteth <S%H982><s%> in the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and through the mercy <S%H2617><s%> of the most High <S%H5945><s%> he shall not <S%H1077><s%> be moved. <S%H4131><s%>
Thine hand <S%H3027><s%> shall find out <S%H4672><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> thine enemies: <S%H341><s%> thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> shall find out <S%H4672><s%> those that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee.

Thou shalt make <S%H7896><s%> them as a fiery <S%H784><s%> oven <S%H8574><s%> in the time <S%H6256><s%> of thine anger: <S%H6440><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall swallow them up <S%H1104><s%> in his wrath, <S%H639><s%> and the fire <S%H784><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> them.

Their fruit <S%H6529><s%> shalt thou destroy <S%H6><s%> from the earth, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H776><s%> and their seed <S%H2233><s%> from among the children <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> they intended <S%H5186><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> thee: they imagined <S%H2803><s%> a mischievous device, <S%H4209><s%> which they are not <S%H1077><s%> able <S%H3201><s%> to perform.

Therefore <S%H3588><s%> shalt thou make <S%H7896><s%> them turn their back, <S%H7926><s%> when thou shalt make ready <S%H3559><s%> thine arrows upon thy strings <S%H4340><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of them.
Be thou exalted, <S%H7311><s%> LORD, <S%H3068><s%> in thine own strength: <S%H5797><s%> so will we sing <S%H7891><s%> and praise <S%H2167><s%> thy power. <S%H1369><s%>
